title: On Baalbek’s edges, the displaced watch strikes rain down on their city
description: Fleeing the Lebanese city of Baalbek ahead of Israeli airstrikes, thousands find shelter — but not necessarily peace of mind — in Deir al-Ahmar.
author: Louisa Loveluck, Suzan Haidamous
excerpt: Fleeing the Lebanese city of Baalbek ahead of Israeli airstrikes, thousands find shelter — but not necessarily peace of mind — in Deir al-Ahmar.
text: DEIR AL-AHMAR, Lebanon — From a hilltop schoolyard in this northeastern town, some of the tens of thousands who had fled Baalbek watched the fireball from an Israeli strike fill the sky above their ancient city.That moment on Wednesday was one of shock and disbelief, they said, coming just hours after the Israeli military had ordered the city’s entire population of 80,000 — and those of its surrounding villages — to flee.
html:
DEIR AL-AHMAR, Lebanon — From a hilltop schoolyard in this northeastern town, some of the tens of thousands who had fled Baalbek watched the fireball from an Israeli strike fill the sky above their ancient city.

That moment on Wednesday was one of shock and disbelief, they said, coming just hours after the Israeli military had ordered the city’s entire population of 80,000 — and those of its surrounding villages — to flee.
